intro: Alonsoa intermedia, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical shrub belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are typically 5-7 lobed and have a velvety texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or red in color. It is native to Central and South America and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields. Alonsoa intermedia is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soils and its use in traditional medicine.
